£270k cut. Opening hours to be reduced.
£600k enterprise centre to be put into Cambridge Central, in partnership with private company Kora: council and Kora will invest £300k Each.
£472k cut. To install free wifi. Extra £10k for outreach / RVS Books on Wheels. Music CD lending to be phased out. Fewer mobile library stops.
Headquarters store will move into Lord Louis Library, halving public space and losing the reading room.
Volunteers may replace paid staff at Blackshots, Chadwell St Mary, Corringham and Stanford-le-Hope. Thameside Library may move into Civic Offices.
BookStart programme no longer funded by Northern Ireland.
Bearwood Community Library in community centre opens March 2015.
West Lothian – Mobile library service to end.
Ledbury Library reopens in Master’s House, £2.9m move from old library.
Strood Library reopens in co-located community hub.
Confirmed that libraries will be run as a mutual trust.
Confirmed that 4 libraries (Bob Lawrence, Hatch End, North Harrow and Rayners Lane) will close.
Rhymney Library will move into youth centre.
Confirmed that libraries will go into leisure trust.
No closures until at least April 1st 2016: volunteers may take over threatened libraries.
Solihull – Dickens Heath Library may move to another location.  Review of service.
Hale Library will either be redeveloped into (i) a smaller library + houses (ii) new library elsewhere or (iii) selling/temporary library until new Altrincham Library in 2017.

Hawarden, Mancot and Queensferry libraries may close: to be replaced by one collocated at Deeside Leisure Centre. Saltney, Hope and Mynydd may close or pass to volunteers.  (counted as 5 under threat).
16% cut in funding since 2013, further cuts soon: consultation.
Northamptonshire – Funding for Business and IP Centre from DCLG. Towcester Library will move into new building in April.
Herefordshire – Kington Library turned into "wellbeing centre".
Reservations of all items within county to be free from 1st April (currently 35p).

Manchester – £250k given by Wolfson Foundation to improve children’s libraries in Wythenshawe Forum Library, Withington Library, Longsight Library, Gorton Library, Newton Heath Library and North City Library in Harpurhey. Library in Hulme High Street opens in leisure centre in partnership with GLL. £45k from DCLG to boost Business and IP Centre at Central Library.
22 out of 28 libraries to be passed to community groups.
"Soft market testing" in order to outsource libraries, in partnership with Bromley.
Birmingham – Staff co-operative likely to be agreed soon for 39 branch libraries.
"Soft market testing" in order to outsource libraries, in partnership with Bexley.
Hertfordshire – Knebworth Library may merge with doctor’s surgery.
Malpas Library reduced to 20 hours opening per week subject to consultation (alternative was closure).
